main event: On December 5, 1956, in Amherst, Massachusetts, a dark round object, the size of a basketball with an exhaust tail shaped like a bell, was observed rising, accelerating, and then disappearing after a 30-second deviation.
interesting points: The observer, a 26-year-old student at the University of Massachusetts, reported the sighting to Westover AFB two days later via long-distance telephone.
The Air Force conducted a preliminary investigation but concluded that there was insufficient data for evaluation.
Possible mundane explanations suggested were sunspots or exhaust blast from jet aircraft known to be in the area at the time of the sighting.
No physical evidence was found to support the sighting.
The observation lasted for 1 to 3 seconds and was classified as a ground-visual type with no optical aids used.
sighted object: one dark round object with a basketball-sized exhaust tail
witnesses: 26-year-old student at the University of Massachusetts
